newsitem.title: JAPAN: JGBs up due to rise in U.S. Treasuries,weak stocks.
newsitem.headline: JGBs up due to rise in U.S. Treasuries,weak stocks.

text.p: The key September 10-year Japanese government bond futures contract was higher in early morning trade on Friday due to a rise in U.S. Treasuries overnight following release of weaker-than-expected U.S. jobs data, traders said.
Weakness in Tokyo share prices was also supportive, traders said.
Traders said investors have been quiet so far this morning.
"The market is being led by futures. It doesn't seem like investors have been buying," said a trader for a city bank's securities unit.
The September stood at 125.14 as of 0050 GMT, up sharply from the previous day's close of 124.73.
The key 182nd JGB yield stood at 2.260 percent, down from the previous day's close of 2.295 percent.
The September is now setting its sights on 125.30, a key chart point, traders said.
